item.title: In Bid To Keep Drivers From Leaving, Uber Tries To Treat Them More Kindly
item.description: July 25, 2017 - Uber is changing its harsh termination policies and launching a new hotline for drivers in distress. Leaders at the tech company are trying to repair the relationship they say is "broken."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - Uber is changing its harsh termination policies and launching a new hotline for drivers in distress. Leaders at the tech company are trying to repair the relationship they say is "broken." http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/25/539227139/in-bid-to-keep-drivers-from-leaving-uber-tries-to-treat-them-more-kindly

item.title: Alabama Woman Stuck In NYC Traffic In 1902 Invented The Windshield Wiper
item.description: July 25, 2017 - Entrepreneur Mary Anderson thought it made no sense that New York streetcar drivers had to keep jumping off to clean snow from the windshield. She soon won a patent for her "window cleaning device."
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - Entrepreneur Mary Anderson thought it made no sense that New York streetcar drivers had to keep jumping off to clean snow from the windshield. She soon won a patent for her "window cleaning device." http://www.npr.org/2017/07/25/536835744/alabama-woman-stuck-in-nyc-traffic-in-1902-invented-the-windshield-wiper

item.title: Apple Unveils New Emoji Designs â€” Including T. Rex And A Zombie
item.description: July 24, 2017 - The world is getting new emoji. Emjoi expert Jeremy Burge talks with Robert Siegel about who gets to decide what icons join the emoji lexicon and how the meaning of those icons can change.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - The world is getting new emoji. Emjoi expert Jeremy Burge talks with Robert Siegel about who gets to decide what icons join the emoji lexicon and how the meaning of those icons can change. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/24/539087926/apple-unveils-56-new-emoji-including-t-rex-and-a-zombie

item.title: Are Helicopter Parents Ruining Summer Camp?
item.description: July 24, 2017 - In a wired world, summer camp is one of the last phone-free zones. But campers, staff and especially parents don't always appreciate the message.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - In a wired world, summer camp is one of the last phone-free zones. But campers, staff and especially parents don't always appreciate the message. http://www.npr.org/sections/ed/2017/07/24/533059271/are-helicopter-parents-ruining-summer-camp

item.title: Bikes May Have To Talk To Self-Driving Cars For Safety's Sake
item.description: July 24, 2017 - Autonomous vehicles have gotten pretty good at detecting other cars and pedestrians. But "seeing" bikes and predicting what they'll do is still a challenge. The answer may lie in bikes themselves.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - Autonomous vehicles have gotten pretty good at detecting other cars and pedestrians. But "seeing" bikes and predicting what they'll do is still a challenge. The answer may lie in bikes themselves. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/24/537746346/bikes-may-have-to-talk-to-self-driving-cars-for-safetys-sake

item.title: Creating A 'Dadbot' To Talk With A Dead Father
item.description: July 23, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks with James Vlahos about his article in Wired. He wrote about creating a chatbot that allows him to "communicate" with his father who died of cancer.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 23, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks with James Vlahos about his article in Wired. He wrote about creating a chatbot that allows him to "communicate" with his father who died of cancer. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/23/538825555/creating-a-dadbot-to-talk-with-a-dead-father

item.title: Screen Saviors: Can Activism-Focused Games Change Our Behavior?
item.description: July 23, 2017 - In recent years, there has been an influx of games centered on social and political issues from sexism to racism to the refugee crisis. In one of the latest, you rescue animals in a slaughterhouse.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 23, 2017 - In recent years, there has been an influx of games centered on social and political issues from sexism to racism to the refugee crisis. In one of the latest, you rescue animals in a slaughterhouse. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/23/538617205/screen-saviors-can-activism-focused-games-change-our-behavior

item.title: Sing Different: Steve Jobs' Life Becomes An Opera
item.description: July 22, 2017 - The Apple co-founder's complicated story is the subject of The (R)evolution Of Steve Jobs, by composer Mason Bates and librettist Mark Campbell. It premieres Saturday in Santa Fe.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 22, 2017 - The Apple co-founder's complicated story is the subject of The (R)evolution Of Steve Jobs, by composer Mason Bates and librettist Mark Campbell. It premieres Saturday in Santa Fe. http://www.npr.org/sections/deceptivecadence/2017/07/22/538088296/sing-different-steve-jobs-life-becomes-an-opera

item.title: I Sink, Therefore I Am: This Robot Wasn't Programmed For Existential Angst
item.description: July 22, 2017 - After a security robot drowned in a fountain in Washington, D.C., NPR's Scott Simon muses on robot suicide, and how long it will be until a robot has the capacity to question its own existence.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 22, 2017 - After a security robot drowned in a fountain in Washington, D.C., NPR's Scott Simon muses on robot suicide, and how long it will be until a robot has the capacity to question its own existence. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/22/538624461/i-sink-therefore-i-am-this-robot-wasnt-programmed-for-existential-angst

item.title: A Future Of Gadgets Without Power Cords? Not So Fast
item.description: July 21, 2017 - This month, the first wireless-charging laptop hit the market. But making wireless power a standard consumer feature is a big technological â€” and psychological â€” challenge.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Spotify Sued, Yet Again, Over Compositions
item.description:
July 21, 2017 - Two new lawsuits against the music streaming leader landed this week, over issues that have already twice led to settlements.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/therecord/2017/07/21/538501163/spotify-sued-yet-again-over-compositions

item.title: How Did The Afghan All-Girl Team Do At The Robotics Competition?
item.description: July 20, 2017 - The Afghan team made headlines even before the event started when their visas were denied. But they made it after all!
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Justice Department Announces Seizure Of Dark Web Marketplace
item.description: July 20, 2017 - The Department of Justice announced Thursday its seizure of an international marketplace on the dark web. AlphaBay provided an anonymous site for people selling illegal drugs, firearms and other items.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - The Department of Justice announced Thursday its seizure of an international marketplace on the dark web. AlphaBay provided an anonymous site for people selling illegal drugs, firearms and other items. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/20/538370711/justice-department-announces-seizure-of-dark-web-marketplace

item.title: In Rural Oregon, Efforts To Bring In Large Data Centers Raise Housing Costs
item.description: July 20, 2017 - In places like rural Oregon, politicians are working to bring in large data centers to town. It's great for folks who want good jobs but don't want to move away. But it's also raising housing costs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - In places like rural Oregon, politicians are working to bring in large data centers to town. It's great for folks who want good jobs but don't want to move away. But it's also raising housing costs. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/20/538370646/in-rural-oregon-efforts-to-bring-in-large-data-centers-raise-housing-costs

item.title: Justice Department Announces 'Largest Darknet Takedown In History'
item.description: July 20, 2017 - A joint operation by the department, the FBI and international law enforcement has shut down AlphaBay and Hansa, two of the world's largest anonymous marketplaces for illicit drugs and goods.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - A joint operation by the department, the FBI and international law enforcement has shut down AlphaBay and Hansa, two of the world's largest anonymous marketplaces for illicit drugs and goods. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/20/538309613/justice-department-announces-largest-darknet-takedown-in-history
